intro: Swartzia juruana, commonly known as the Juruana tree, is a tropical evergreen species native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and woody, aromatic bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by pod-like fruits containing flat, seed-like structures. It is valued for its hard, heavy wood used in traditional crafts and as a source of natural dyes. Swartzia juruana also plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
